body.name: SHAKING TANK ARGB and PWM HUB,9 Ports for Addressable RGB Lighting with PWM,1 to 9 Multi Way Magnetic backplane Splitter 5V/3PIN ARGB Case Fan Hub Adapter PWM ARGB Fan Black¡­
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 19 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 1 hr 39 mins

features: SHAKING TANK Addressable rgb controller adopts 2 in 1 designs to connect PWM and ARGB cables, which can effectively sort out the layout of intricate wiring and make chassis wiring more convenient and concise.

SHAKING TANK 2in1 PWM & ARGB fan hub contains 9 5v-3pin Aura SYNC Addressable RGB ports and 9 4pin PWM ports whiches simultaneously power maximum 9 ARGB-PWM fans in total to offer combo fan solution for PC building,SATA power maintains stable output even at full load.

SHAKING TANK 2in1 PWM & ARGB fan hub widely supports Aura SYNC includes ASUS Aura, GIGABYTE Fusion, MSI Mystic Light and ASRock Polychrome to build a view stunning world of dancing ARGB Light with the interface providing stable continuous power for all your lighting components

The compact desigh of SC790 makes a sturdy PWM & ARGB fan hub to optimize the cable management in the gaming case which can be placed almost anywhere of the case thanks to the magnetic backplane, meanwhile；It also comes with a piece of Adhesive Velcro, so that your case of any material has been easily applied
The fan hub can support up to 8 fans, including a total of 8 4-pin PWM ports and 8 ARGB ports for ARGB fans or ARGB devices. NOTE: DOSE NOT SUPPORT 4-PIN RGB DEVICE.

Fan speed can be adjusted by PWM signal from motherboard, only the speed of "Fan 1" can be read by the system. The speed control function is unavailable for 3 pin fans, the attached 3 pin fans will run at maximum RPM.
body.description: SHAKING TANK Addressable rgb controller adopts 2 in 1 designs to connect PWM and ARGB cables, which can effectively sort out the layout of intricate wiring and make chassis wiring more convenient and concise.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Inexpensive with good compatibility
reviews.reviewText: I'm using this hub to control 8 Phanteks D30 fans using MSI Mystic light. Everything works as it should with no problems. The only issue was the thicker RGB plugs on the Phanteks fans didn't fit into the hub, but shaving them down was easily done and took all of five minutes.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A Must-Have for Cooler Master Fans
reviews.reviewText: As an avid fan of Cooler Master as a brand, I recently added the Cooler Master 1-to-10 4PIN SATA PWM Hub to my setup, and it has been a game-changer!Impressive Fan Control:The PWM hub allows me to effortlessly control up to 10 PWM fans with just a single connection to my motherboard. It's incredibly convenient and gives me full control over my system's cooling performance.Simple and Compact Design:The hub's design is sleek and compact, making it easy to install and tuck away neatly in my PC case. Its low profile doesn't interfere with other components, keeping my build clean and organized.Reliable Power Source:The 4PIN SATA connection ensures a stable power supply for all connected fans. It eliminates the need for multiple fan headers on the motherboard, making cable management a breeze.Perfect for Cooler Master Fans:Being a loyal Cooler Master fan, I couldn't be happier with this hub. It perfectly complements my other Cooler Master components, and I can trust the brand's commitment to quality and performance.Optimized Cooling Performance:Thanks to the hub's efficient fan control, my PC's cooling performance has significantly improved. I can fine-tune fan speeds to maintain optimal temperatures during intensive tasks and gaming sessions.Ideal for Enthusiasts and Modders:For enthusiasts like me who love tinkering with their setups and modding their rigs, this hub is a must-have. It opens up possibilities for creative fan configurations and allows me to create the perfect airflow setup.Premium Build Quality:As expected from Cooler Master, the hub boasts premium build quality. It feels sturdy and durable, assuring me that it will last through many future upgrades.Final Verdict:In conclusion, the Cooler Master 1-to-10 4PIN SATA PWM Hub is a fantastic addition to my Cooler Master setup, and it has exceeded my expectations. As a Cooler Master fan, I'm delighted with the hub's performance, design, and reliability. It provides efficient fan control and optimizes my cooling system, giving me peace of mind during heavy usage. If you're a Cooler Master enthusiast or just someone who appreciates quality PC components, this hub is worth every penny. It's a valuable investment for those seeking a top-notch fan control solution. Cooler Master has once again proven why they are a brand I love and trust. I can't recommend this hub enough to fellow fans of the brand!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars ARGB connectors fit Cooler Master brand fans
reviews.reviewText: I bought this to use with my Cooler Master H500 case. I recently upgraded the 200mm fans to ARGB, as I had an older version from 2018/19 when I bought it. However, I ran into the issue where the ASUS brand fans on the AIO would not fit in the fan hub. The fan hub is very well made to exacting measurements. The ASUS fans ARGB connectors are just slightly too fat to fit. The Master Fans connectors fit fine. Other issue is that some of the wires were too far from it and I'd need to get extensions to be able to connect them all. In the end, I didn't use the hub at all and used the motherboard supplied ARGB splitter that looks kind of like a squid. I had a second one from another build I just started and didn't need and also found that my mobo had a second ARGB port. I used the second squid for that. I can't comment on the functionality. For now, it's going into my drawer for when I need a fan hub.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Exactly what I needed…
reviews.reviewText: I have an iBuyPower PC from 2021 and the fans that came with it were terrible. Their fans are proprietary junk that has a six pin connector, making them next to impossible to find direct replacements to attach to their rgb controller. I had to replace every one of the 4 fans in the system TWICE OVER because they failed and developed a loud squeel(no hole to be able to oil them either). Every day, I’d have to open the chassis up and stop the fan(s) and hope when the restarted, they wouldn’t squeel. I finally had enough. I bought this to replace the proprietary fan controller and also for 4 cooler master fans.The install was surprisingly easy. I used the jRainbow 2 header on the motherboard and the same fan header the original controller used and everything fired right up and the MSI Center app saw the new controller and the rgb and fan speeds were then controllable, just like the original.I did keep the original controller in place(plugged into the jRainbow 1 port) to continue to power the motherboard and liquid cooling rgb leds and the MSI app sees both jRainbow 1 and 2 ports individually(giving me more rgb flexibility than I had with just one controller)Overall, this worked great for me on my Z490-A Pro MSI motherboard. Now, no more sqeeling fans!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Worth every penny maybe more
reviews.reviewText: I bought this controller to help control my fans more so with their ARGB than PWM but was nice to have both, and seeing as i had 7 ARGB PWM fans and most controllers only supported 6 or less and looked very cheap this one stood out.Comes with a magnetic back(not the strongest in the world considering the weight of the cords connected to it and itself) but also is provided with the option of velcro sticky pads if wanted(was a nice touch which i didnt use)This controller works with both 3 and 4 pin ARGB fans but not 4 pin PWM fans which was great as i had 3 3 pin and 4 4 pin fansAll fans work perfect with Aura sync and controls followed the speed of my CPU fan(motherboard had a CPU output port which works great because my cpu fan wire was to short to reach the controller which is what was the recommended way to install)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewText: So to those who said the fans are too loud… before I thought of sending it back, I looked up as to why. Simply put, it’s because of the BIOS settings. I changed the mode from DC to PWM in the Hardware Monitor (which that is what the connector attached to the MOBO is), adjust it to all the fans that applies, and bam the fans are quieter again. Hope this helps!

No lo he podido usar,ya que los cambios en las tarjetas madre ,me hace esperar a gastar en armar mi propia pc,ademas muchas de las tarjetas madre actuales tienen wifi integrado,y las formas actuales de Robo de señal wifi me hace a uno esperar mas.
This thing is absolutely excellent, the build quality is exceptional.
Me gustó que se adhiere al chassis con el imán. Buena calidad.
